channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2024030551
item.description:
Report X-2024030551

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Illinois Central Railroad Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 03-05-2024 a CN transportation employee observed liquid running down the side of tank car from the top # UTLX 668009 at the CN Baton Rouge Yard located in Baton Rouge, LA. The employee reported the observation to the Transportation Manager who in turn initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The on duty Dangerous Goods Officer dispatched an emergency response contractor to the yard to investigate. The responding contractor's initial observation found product residue on both sides of the tank car. Further assessment revealed that all (6) manway cover swing bolts were less than tool tight (could turn by hand) with (1) of the swing bolts in the down position causing a leak from the manway cover due to an improper seal of the gasket. The shipper security seal was found to be intact. The shipper manway cover security seal was removed and the cover was opened for the purpose of replacing the gasket. The manway cover swing bolts were then tightened in a star pattern utilizing an 18" pipe wrench. The tank car was then moved to an accessible track for the purpose of exterior cleaning.

item.title: Report X-2024030750
item.description:
Report X-2024030750

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-25T15:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-08
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was sitting on roller in unload when QA noticed the box was wet from the top. Plus it had a strong smell coming from the box. QA immediately got a red tote and transported hazmat to cage to be processed properly. DescribePack: The cap on one of the bottles was loose. Despite the great packing from the shipper the cap still failed to be on tight and the product leaked eating through the box as well as the inner packing. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed in red tote making sure nobody else touched the box and placed hazmat in cage to be processed properly.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Upon arrival and offloading from the truck during the sort, the box appeared wet and was placed in the hazmat bin then brought to the Hazmat cage for further inspection. DescribePack: The failure from the package occured with the cap on one of the bottles of Power Con. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: To help mitigate the package, the contents were placed inside a hazmat bin and away from other packages to possibly cause damage.

DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside the hazmat bin to separate itself from other packages causing harm to them.

item.title: Report X-2024030674
item.description:
Report X-2024030674

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-15
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The commodity being shipped are Duracell dry cell batteries. While the shipment is classified as "nonhazard", the shipment began to emit dangerous evolution of heat, triggering an NRC notifciation. On 3/15/2024 at approximately 2200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5013755 at the station location in Baton Rouge, reporting a package with a dangerous evolution of heat. The shipment consisted of 12 ‘D’ cell batteries which, after further inspection, appeared to be swollen. During delivery, the driver discovered the package was warm to the touch and returned it to the station. This incident has been to be NRC under Report # 1393991 was generated by Ms. Rawls. Due to the reporting requirements to the NRC, this shipment is also being reported to the FAA and is being held for further disposition instructions.

item.title: Report X-2024030569
item.description:
Report X-2024030569

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-07
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On March 7th a package was discovered that was warm to the touch and was emitting smoke. The package was marked as a non-spillable battery. Once it was removed outdoors it cooled down so that it could be opened. A small amount of charring was found inside the package along with a damaged non-spillable battery. The battery was placed into a salvage drum.

item.title: Report X-2024030550
item.description:
Report X-2024030550

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-24
  • City: GEISMAR
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Illinois Central Railroad Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 02-24-2024 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping down the side of tank car # UTLX 125078 (Loaded - Spent Sulfuric Acid - UN ID - 1832 - Class 8) while performing switching operations at the CN Geismar Yard located in Geismar, LA. The employee notified the CN Transportation Manager who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team for an emergency response. The responding CN Dangerous Goods Officer performed an inspection of the tank car and noted spillage on the BL side of the car and liquid dripping the eduction line securement flange. Further inspection revealed: (1) of the (4) flange securement fasteners was not properly tightened and could be freely moved by hand. The 1" air valve was in the completely open position with its securement plug securely installed. The 2" liquid eduction line securement cap was less than tool tight (could be turned by hand. The loose liquid eduction line cap was the source of the leak. The tank car's internal pressure was relieved through the 1" air valve stopping the leak. The Liquid eduction line securement cap was properly tightened with an 18" pipe wrench. The 1" air valve was closed, and its securement plug was properly tightened with an 18" pipe wrench. The tank car was then decontaminated by a CN hired contractor. A contractor hired by the responsible party replaced all (4) liquid eduction line flange bolts and securement nuts. The tank car was then pressured up to 10 PSI with a standard air compressor and inspected for leaks. No leaks were discovered.

item.title: Report I-2024020039
item.description:
Report I-2024020039

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: Bossier city
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 2
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 03:38 pallet was pulled off trailer a drip was noticed, it was loaded back in the trailer. leak was contained to our trailer and the dock. It was noticed that the pallet seemed to be wedged under a load bar damaging a box of pool supplies. At 5:00 the odor was getting worse it was believed the amount Ieaking was more than first thought, hazmat one was called at 05:08 to come and clean up the material. Hazmat one arrived at 06:45 and completed at 11:02.
